TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MsmqIntegrationBindingElement extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqBindingElementBase
Public NotInheritable Class MsmqIntegrationBindingElement Inherits MsmqBindingElementBase

Docs.summary: This binding element can be used to enable Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) applications to send messages to and receive messages from existing MSMQ applications that use either COM, MSMQ native APIs, or the APIs in . Use this class to send and receive messages from MSMQ-based messaging applications.

Docs.param: The with which to build the channel factory.
Docs.summary: Builds a channel factory using the context provided.
Docs.returns: An MSMQ integration channel factory that can be used to create channels to send messages to existing MSMQ applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method builds a channel factory that enables the developer to create a client channel to communicate with a service. The channel factory is not a channel, but rather a factory that can create a channel. You create a channel by calling `IChannelFactory<TChannel>.CreateChannel`.

-or-

-or-

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener<TChannel> BuildChannelListener<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) where TChannel : class, System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel;

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener`1<!!TChannel> BuildChannelListener<class (class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel) TChannel>(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) cil managed
Public Overrides Function BuildChannelListener(Of TChannel As {Class, IChannel}) (context As BindingContext) As IChannelListener(Of TChannel)

override this.BuildChannelListener : System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext -> System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener<'Channel (requires 'Channel : null and 'Channel :> System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel)> (requires 'Channel : null and 'Channel :> System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel)

Docs.param: The with which to build the channel listener.
Docs.summary: Builds a channel listener using the context provided.
Docs.returns: An MSMQ integration channel listener that can be used to create channels to receive messages from existing MSMQ applications.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Channel listeners are created on the service and are used to receive messages sent by a client channel. The service must call `IChannelListener.Open` and then `IChannelListener.AcceptChannel` to get a reference to the actual channel. Then `IChannel.Open` must be called to open the channel. At this point, the channel can be used to retrieve messages.

-or-

-or-
is set to WindowsDomain and if MSMQ is installed without Active Directory integration.

Docs.summary: Gets a that contains the scheme used by the binding element.
Docs.value: The that contains the scheme used by the binding element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property returns the string "msmq.formatname" to indicate the addressing scheme used by the MSMQ integration channel. For more information about queue addressing, see [Service Endpoints and Queue Addressing](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/service-endpoints-and-queue-addressing.md).

Public Property SerializationFormat As MsmqMessageSerializationFormat

public: property System::ServiceModel::MsmqIntegration::MsmqMessageSerializationFormat SerializationFormat { System::ServiceModel::MsmqIntegration::MsmqMessageSerializationFormat get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::MsmqIntegration::MsmqMessageSerializationFormat value); };
member this.SerializationFormat : System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the to be used when serializing MSMQ messages.
Docs.value: The to be used when serializing MSMQ messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can have one of the following values:
- `ActiveX` - The ActiveX serializer is used to serialize objects.
- `Binary` - The <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter> is used to serialize objects.
- `ByteArray` - The object is serialized to an array of bytes.
- `Stream` - The object is serialized to a stream.
- `Xml` - The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> is used to serialize objects.
- The default value is `Xml`.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_UE_MsmqToWcf#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_ue_msmqtowcf/cs/snippets.cs#3)]

Docs.exception: The value is not within the values of .

MemberSignature.Value: public Type[] TargetSerializationTypes { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Type[] TargetSerializationTypes
Public Property TargetSerializationTypes As Type()
public: property cli::array <Type ^> ^ TargetSerializationTypes { cli::array <Type ^> ^ get(); void set(cli::array <Type ^> ^ value); };
member this.TargetSerializationTypes : Type[] with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of objects that contain the types to which messages should be deserialized.
Docs.value: An array of that contains the types to which messages should be deserialized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The body of an MSMQ message is not typed. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqIntegrationBindingElement.TargetSerializationTypes%2A> property enables you to specify the types to which messages are deserialized when they are sent from an MSMQ application to a Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) receiving application. This property is used only if <xref:System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat> is set to `Xml`.
